website_summaries.verdict: New tool that sucks out the mosquito poison, preventing further itching.
pros: This relieves pain and irritation without creams, gels, or chemicals
Works on all kinds of bug bites, including those from bed bugs, mosquitoes, bees, wasps, and biting ants
Reusable as long as you wash it properly
cons: Works best within 12 hours of being bitten, but worth a try if a day has passed

customer_reviews.title: Not just for bug bites!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I got this because my son reacts really bad to mosquito bites. But... bored mom was in the bathroom one day and noticed a black head on her nose. Bam!!! This thing will clean your pores too!!! DO NOT USE ON THIN SKIN ON FACE UNLESS YOU WANT A HICKY. But my nose, chin and cheeks look soo much better. Bonus, it's cheaper than buying a 50 dollar electric black head remover. Highly recommend for people with large funky pores.
customer_reviews.author: tara st.pierre

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I am a magnet for bites of all kinds and carry topical and medicines with me at all times - so I figured this would be a good product to see if it really works. It arrived Monday and Tuesday morning I woke up with a bug bite on my arm... I used this little tool (3 x per the instructions) and documented with photos. - immediately after using, it stopped itching! And less than 24 hours later the bump / bite gone! There is a very faint red mark from using the thing but a small price to pay IMO. Bottom line: it’s awesome. I’m carrying it with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Weird but helpful
customer_reviews.text: Do I think it removes all the irritants? No. Does it prevent welts? No. But does it remove enough to prevent my kid from scratching open sores on himself? Hell, yes! This seriously upgraded our summer by making mosquito bites short-lived bothers rather than week-long sores.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: maybe a lifesaver for wasp or bee stings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i have wasps near my garden. I never expected to need it 2 days after receiving it, but I was stung twice yesterday. I used it on each of the stings, and immediately reduced the pain and itching of those stings. today there is still some swelling at the sites, but considering that the last time i got stung i was on antihistamines, cortisone cream, and pain killers for a week, this simple device has already been well worth the expense. I'm not sure how it would work for mosquito bites but for wasp or bee stings this is the bomb!
customer_reviews.author: Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Just ... okay.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to pass up an inexpensive product with great reviews, but I'm not too convinced about its effectiveness. I've had it for a few days and tried it on multiple mosquito bites, but it maybe reduces itchiness 50% of the time. I suppose it's just ... okay. It wasn't a mind blowing experience by any means. It was about as effective as any anti-itch cream. Your mileage may vary and it's cheap enough to test out for yourself without breaking the bank. It might work better for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made my bites so much worse!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product since I have a more severe reaction to mosquito bites here in the south. Boy did it do the OPPOSITE of what it states. I used it on a bite on the top of my left hand and it appeared to draw up the poison and trap it. My hand swole up and was itchy hot for 2 days; even with taking benadryl regulary. I tried it on 2 other bites at the time and they had similar reactions. Pic shows the in between phase before entire topside became swollen. It became so swollen I was able to push down on it and it would leave "pits" (like pitted edema). Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son has horrible skin reactions to mosquito bites. I bought this in desperation. It is a total waste of money. I tried it on a fresh mosquito bite and it didn’t do a thing. It still got hard and itchy. The intensity and long lasting effects of the bite weren’t improved at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Burton

customer_reviews.title: Works for blackheads 😬
customer_reviews.text: Honestly haven't had the chance to use this for bug bites.... It currently lives in my bathroom as my blackhead removal tool! Seriously this works great at removing blackhead. Don't hold in one spot, "drive" it around a problem area and it will suck the gunk out! Don't knock it till you try it
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for mosquito bites
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. As soon as I get a mosquito bite, I get the tool right away. I suck and suck and suck and suck, reposition, suck. Doesn’t make a difference on how big it gets, how much it itches, how long it lasts, anything.
customer_reviews.author: LLH

customer_reviews.title: FAKE, DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this thing... It does have suction! and will leave a mark from the suction. So yes it does suck!! However, i have tried it a few times and never has it ever sucked anything out of my skin, and did not give me any relief. :(
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: It's good for stings, not for bites
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really help much with mosquito bites, but when it comes to wasps stings, this bad boy literally sucks the venom out. My soon to be ex got stung and this bad boy just completely got rid of the venom. There's the problem of the smaller suction not working because the cap won't stick in reverse like it claims. In conclusion, It's good for bee/wasp/hornet stings, but it doesn't do squat for mosquito bites.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do anything
customer_reviews.text: I am very allergic to certain strains of mosquito so I will try anything to help get rid of the itch fast before I need to go get prescriptions to do the job. This does absolutely nothing for me except leave a big red mark highlighting where the bite is. I will stick with Benedryl itch cooling gel for now.
customer_reviews.author: Tov

customer_reviews.title: If your allergic to mosquitoes this is your new best friend!
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to mosquitoes so summer is a pain for me. I have gotten bites the size of softballs and so bad that my whole foot swole up. With the bug bite thing as soon as I feel a bite or itching I use it a couple times on the spot and the itching stops. Depending on how fast I used it I either won’t swell up at all or it doesn’t swell as big as it normally would have. This has really helped me a lot in the summer and am so glad I found this product I carry it with me everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work but it’s a good laugh!
customer_reviews.text: So this became a fun toy for my kids, they goes mommy you got a mosquito bite? Let get the bug bite thing!! Then start using it on me! They definitely got a good laugh from that circle mark that leave on my skin after it suction... I feel that the laughter from my children made the money worth on this useless thing.. does it really help with the itchiness of the bug bites? The answer is no!! It doesn’t help at all, you are still going to itch and feel the pains!!
customer_reviews.author: kalee Li

customer_reviews.title: Life changer!
customer_reviews.text: My wife usually swells up from mosquito bites and they always find her no matter where we go. One night she couldn’t sleep because she had 3 bites and kept scratching uncuntrollably. So then we remembered we packed this in our trip! We used it about 3 times in each bite for 10 seconds each. It stopped the swelling and when she woke up the swelling disappeared! The swelling usually lasts for days! And there were no “hickey” marks or bruises. There were only initially ring marks when we first used it. Then the next day we used it on a completely new bite and it prevented any swelling or itching from occurring!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martindale

customer_reviews.title: Ended up with cellulitis !!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. Actually seemed to make my bug bite worse. I used it immediately after getting a bite and within 2 days ended up in urgent care with cellulitis. Wouldn’t use this again.
customer_reviews.author: CinnyTheShibaMom

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bugs/mosquitos, etc. LOVE to bit me. Then I swell and itch for a week. I found this in an online article and tried it. It WORKS!! I move the handles down first. Then I press the Thing very firmly over the bite. Then I pull up very slowly until I can feel the suction. Then I push the handles down before I take it off. No swelling, no pain I might do it once or twice and it only itches for 1 or 2 days. Glory!! Some just stop immediately after I do it. THIS is a LIFE Saver!!
customer_reviews.author: AW-Smile

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Much to my surprise this has worked for me several times now. I am amazed how this simple product stops the itching and swelling of mosquito bites!
customer_reviews.author: Cmgp

customer_reviews.title: Itchy or Hickey - you choose!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a game changer. If it doesn't completely cure the itch with one pull, you just do it again. The hickey it leaves behind is a small price to pay for itch relief. Also, I believe it just depends on everyone's skin type as to how much redness occurs and for how long. Besides, if you are going for the look, does a scratched-up-till-it-bleeds bite look any better than a hickey?
customer_reviews.author: Beaucaire

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work for bites
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's fine for stings, we had some major rainfall the past month in Florida so the mosquitos were vicious still biting even with bug spray. I bought this for my toddler mostly and it pinches when it sucks and it didn't stop the itching. I found it a waste of money so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Anyone that needs EpiPen should try this new device that really works!
customer_reviews.text: This new easy to use Bug Bite Suction tool is just amazing. Our daughter is very allergic to most bites and with EpiPens being so expensive and hard to find, this new tool is brilliant and so easy. No medicine involved. It just sucks out the poison from the bite and “IT Works! A great invention!!! Kmorris 1-Tx
customer_reviews.author: kmorris1-San Antonio Tx

customer_reviews.title: Temporary relief unless you lance bite first.
customer_reviews.text: This gizmo is unlikely to bring more than temporary relief to a bite site unless you lance the histamine bubble and draw out the irritant. If you’re reactive and itch a lot, the suction won’t completely pull the histamine out thru unbroken skin. It will eventually dissipate and begin itching again. If you’re sensitive enough to need this product I’d recommend getting a comedone extractor tool to lance the bite site to fully remove irritant so you’re treating the bite once instead of repeatedly. Be sure to clean site with some alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this, however, I was not impressed. This thing leaves a huge red mark where the bite it and essentially brings blood to the surface (think little baby hickies) wherever you’ve been bitten. These sores then scab over and take forever to heal. You’re better off squeezing the bite if you want to get the poison out. And the dang things still itch. In theory this thing looks awesome. In reality, it’s going in the trash because I missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This does not seem to do anything to help reduce swelling or irritation from bug bites. I haven’t tried it on a bee sting but have tried it on multiple mosquito bites on different kids but it didn’t seem to help. I’ve also tried it within minutes of getting a bite and it’s made no difference. My kids are super prone to bug bites and both have strong reactions to them. I was hoping this would help, but so far it hasn’t. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Risaliti

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, do not believe other reviewers!
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely does not work, do not believe the other reviewers that all rave about it, I'm not sure how it has such a high star rating with over 2000 reviews, but it does not work. I've tried it on about 5-6 bug bites at this point, ranging in age from just bitten to a day old and it has not worked on any of them! I've even tried it twice on the same bite, it does not work. I'm always getting a lot of bites in the summer and thought this would help (normally I'll use benadryl gel) but it does not help at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mellymagne

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea... but doesn't work at all for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it within minutes of being bitten by mosquitoes, I've tried doing it multiple times after being bitten... it just doesn't do anything for me. I was really excited, because I have a severe allergy to mosquito bites, so anything to give relief was exciting, but sadly this hasn't worked. And because I was so excited, I read the instructions then threw away the packaging when it arrived, so I can't return it. At least it wasn't more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tarirose

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I went camping and came home with over 20 itchy bug bites on my feet, ankles, and legs. I bought the bug bite thing in hopes it would relieve the itching, and unfortunately it did not do much for me. I tried both sizes and alternated holding it for 10 seconds and 30 seconds. When the suction mark wore off the bites were the same size and just as itchy. Also no one mentioned how badly the suction hurts! I would never use this on a kid, so I’m not sure how it got it’s “kid friendly” rating. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I get huge blisters from bug bites normally and usually have a very intense itch. This is easy to use and removes the itch almost immediately. There’s also the ability to flip the suction tool to a smaller surface area for toes which is wonderful. I was a little worried with the pictures of bruises on the other reviews but u can adjust the suction so I haven’t had a problem. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Every mom wants this
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Instant relief. I did not read the hold 10-30 seconds then repeat so I had a small hickey around them but since then I have not.
customer_reviews.author: cassi

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic turned believer!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had really bad reactions to mosquito bites. I get big welts, and the itching is unbearable. I bought the Bug Bite Thing after reading the reviews in hopes that it would help. I wasn't sure it would, but I figured I'd give it a try. I was in the park the other night, and the bugs were biting! As soon as I got home, I used the Bug Bite Thing on the bites I found. Surprisingly, the next morning there was no itching in those areas. I have to admit that I was quite surprised that it worked! I'm ordering another one to keep in my hiking backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Vick1LTop Contributor: Yoga

customer_reviews.title: GET IT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how effective this gadget would be but it's actually a fantastic help! My child's mosquito bites swell up but with The Bug Bite thing, we've been able to avoid those large welts. You can adjust the amount of suction pressure applied. The opposite side of the removable tip enables you to get bites in smaller areas such as between fingers and it really does work. This has been really helpful!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Cron

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 boys who get eaten up by bugs when they play outside. I was really hoping this would help with the swelling they get with mosquito bites and the itch. It just doesn't. Even after using it on a bug bite a few times, the itch is still there and I have to put on an anti itch cream for them. My husband even used it and said he didn't notice it help him at all. It made the bug bites very red/dark because of the suction. I am pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: REALLY REALLY Gets Toxin Out of a Bee Sting!!! Easy to use, great price - EVERY household should have one!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awesome thing - it actually sucks the toxin out of a bee sting! We do it 3 or 4 times on a sting and with each suction, I can wipe off a drop of toxin which is one less drop of it in the blood stream of whoever got stung. My husband has several bee hives and he gets stung every so often. So this is FANTASTIC for him.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Goggins

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR SKEETERS SYNDROME - MOSQUITO BITE ALLERGY
customer_reviews.text: This will always be considered one of the best inventions ever to me. I used to get mosquito bites that would end up anywhere from 6-10 inch diameter on my body. (Skeeter syndrome). It gave me so much anxiety to even be outdoors. This has saved me. Yes I still get bit but if I catch it, even a few minutes after, it won’t exceed a nickels size. This has been a life changer. DONT HESITATE if you’re on the fence. We have three and keep them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: tapasos

customer_reviews.title: Love it. We use for mosquito bites mostly
customer_reviews.text: We carry our Bug bite thing in the car, take on vacations, etc. Love it. We use for mosquito bites mostly...but I will tell you, my husband actually got stung by a wasp after we bought this and I cant tell you how excited I was! Not for this discomfort of course, but I could wait to see if the bug sucker would actually suck out the stinger...it did!!!!! So satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: E. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use-- but doesn't work on every skin type
customer_reviews.text: This flawlessly works on my boyfriend for small mosquito bites, but for someone like me who gets bitten often and swollen bites, this almost never works on me. For my boyfriend, this sucks out anything that causes the bite to itch and is visible. If you react highly to mosquito bites, there's a good chance this won't work for you. If you have a low/mild reaction to mosquito bites, this will work perfectly and cure the bite almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kakanas

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: A waste of money. The concept is good, but the suction isn't at all effective. If anything, it irritated my insect bites further.
customer_reviews.author: Shine On 1

customer_reviews.title: Simple - some people swear by it!
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and seems to noticeably reduce the irritation a recent bite causes you. Make sure to read the simple directions and follow them. Don't apply too much pressure, and make sure to apply the pressure for the appropriate amount of time. I don't feel like it does much to a bite that is more than an hour or two old. I also would avoid using it on a bite that has been itched much, because applying suction to broken skin results in increased bleeding. I've had about a dozen people try it and most agree that it provides a significant reduction of itching when used on a recent bite.
customer_reviews.author: Orweller Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for Mosquitoes!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bug Bite Thing because mosquitoes love me. I've tried it on a lot of mosquito bites, and it never works for me. I've tried following the instructions to the letter. I've tried using it more times or longer, but nothing I do seems to work. Maybe this works for other bug bites, but don't buy it for mosquito bites!
customer_reviews.author: The Nerdy Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little “Sucker”!
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is a miracle worker for bug bites! I was a skeptic until I tried it as I get attacked by bugs or any type of bugs outdoors. And my bites get so puffy as I’m pretty much allergic to all bugs. I used this little “sucker” and it totally did what it promised! No need for creams n ointments for me! Totally worth the purchase...I got some for my parents too and they love it! Easy to use and it works !
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D

customer_reviews.title: Does not work if you have skeeter syndrome (mosquito bite allergy)
customer_reviews.text: I have skeeter syndrome (my bites swell REALLY bad), and this tool was completely ineffective. I could see it possibly working for some, but if you react to bites like I do, pass on this and just stick with good preventative measures (lots and lots of bugspray!). Suction power is quite good, perhaps I will be able to find another use for it.
customer_reviews.author: SmileyCorn

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several months now and tried using it about 10 different times on mosquito bites, but have never noticed a difference in them afterwards. Still itchy, and they don't go away any faster. The only difference is that sometimes I will get a bruise around the bite from the suction. I can see this working well if you have a stinger in you that needs to come out, but not sure it does much for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Birds of a Feather Events

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when my wife bought this. My son is very allergic to mosquito bites and swells up for days around the bite site. We've always just put essential oils on the bite and that does okay but he still gets swollen and he itches it all week (often until it bleeds). Since using this suction tool, the swelling is 80% reduced and it doesn't seem to cause him to itch the bite site for very long. The important thing is, you have to use it right after the bite occurs for it to work the best. This product is definitely worth a try. I am serious believer in it's effectiveness to reduce the effects of the bite.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Hasn’t worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine almost a month and I can say for sure that it doesn’t work on black fly bites. The only itch relief I experienced only lasted as long as the suction. And it was unable to remove a small tick head from the top of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: R. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: In the last few years for whatever reason, my body has become so allergic to mosquitoes. My bites usually swell and blister somewhat. The itching only subsides with prescribed ointment or extreme heat on the bites. Enter this little tool- and I am a believer. I literally woke up one morning with 2 bites on my leg. I immediately used this little tool and the itching subsided immediately. Hours later when the itching was coming back, I did it again. I repeated this until the bite got smaller and smaller. If I catch it in time, this little bug bite tool drastically reduces the time that the bite takes to heal. So glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Obermeyer

customer_reviews.title: takes the edge of the itch away
customer_reviews.text: purchased this bug bite thing after seeing it on TV. the name alone deserved a purchase. my youngest is allergic to may flies and other bugs so I wanted to get something that is chemical free. this is a very interesting idea and does work slightly. the suction is really powerful but the effects afterward are minimal. it does take the edge away but the itch comes back minutes later. it also seems to keep the bite site a little less inflamed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: This "thing" is my hero!
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting mosquito and spider bites this year like never before, and the burning from them has been intense. Saw this "thing" on Amazon and bought it. If you're wondering about the reviews that say "it doesn't work!" I can only assume the user isn't using it correctly. I can attest that it works, works quickly, and is easy to use. I will admit, I have given myself a few "hickies" (round bruises) a few times, but those are the exceptions. I hold it in place at least 45 seconds. Honestly I can feel relief within 15 seconds of starting. I like it so my I'm going to post a YouTube video the next time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Singer

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those items you didn’t know you needed in your life! It has worked great for me and all members of my family between ages 3-14. It has stopped the itching after use without us even realizing, I wouldn’t go anywhere without it!! One of my boys had extreme adverse reaction to bug bites and so far we have not experienced any!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L.

customer_reviews.title: Works for tick bites too!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very small tick on me. I got the tick off and immediately used the Bug Bite thing. I have not had any itching. Normally, tick bites itch terribly. This is a keeper! It says nothing about ticks, but it worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: I am a mosquito magnet. This has been my only relief
customer_reviews.text: All my life I've been a mosquito magnet. It really sucks. I bought a house that regularly gets mosquitos in the backyard and I'm in my own personal itchy hell when they come out. I bought this just to try it and OMG its the only things that has ever given me any relief. I'd say it works 98% of the time. I love this thing. I lost it and bought another one. I never want to live without it ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Wedge

customer_reviews.title: TEMPORARY relief
customer_reviews.text: While it does provide some temporary (a few moments) relief, it certainly isn’t doing what it says it is doing. My kid is a mosquito magnet, plus every bite turns into a big welt and she scratches herself raw. She has been carrying this around with her since it arrived last week, constantly “sucking” the same bites over and over. The only reason I give 2 stars, rather than 1, is because it’s better than scratching the bites. The suction almost seems to numb the area temporarily so you don’t feel compelled to scratch. For a few moments. Although she is still ripping open bites overnight when she isn’t using this thing...
customer_reviews.author: KJA

customer_reviews.title: It seems like everything that can bite or sting that gets into ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems like everything that can bite or sting that gets into close proximity with me bites me or stings me and I almost always have a nasty reaction. This works to lessen the severity of stings and bites for me. Such a simple thing. In the short time I have had it it has already brought me much relief from a variety of bites and stings. I carry it in my purse so I have it with me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla A. Pulscher

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a mosquito magnet and have tried countless sprays/candles/clips/etc to keep them away. I then spend days trying not to scratch the bites and slathering then with hydrocortisone cream. Decided to try this bug bite suction thing and was happily shocked when it worked!!! Got several bites working in the garden and used the suction on each of them. The skin was red from the suction for a few hours but the bites didn’t itch. Once the redness faded, I saw the bites were practically gone- little flat red mark that looks like a 4-5 day old bite! NO ITCHING AT ALL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lea M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle-worker for my toddler. I bought this after receiving a spider bite on my foot, that was already healed when it came in. Two days after delivery, my 2.5 year old got stung by a bee or wasp and was screaming and in tears. I broke this out, and he immediately went from screaming to laughing as I used it. It was amazing. He got his second sting today, and the same thing happened—instant pain relief. I don’t know what I would do without this thing. Plus, he likes to play with it afterwards which further calms him down. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Briley Black

customer_reviews.title: I'm still itchy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing a while. I've used it a lot. It has never worked for me. I got like 10 bites last night. As soon as I got in the house and noticed I was itchy and had been a meal for a family of mosquitos, I attacked all of the bites with my hickey maker, I mean Bug Bite Thing. I used it to suck long and hard on each bite. I thought it worked. Nope. Overnight I was awakened by the incessant itchiness of the bites on my legs and ankles. It didn't suck anything out of any of the bites. I tried it again today. Didn't work. I wish it worked. Apparently I'm delicious. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: iGirl

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You won't regret it! It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bug bite suction tool. It REALLY works! When I get mosquito bite they swells and itch SOO BAD. So immediately after I get bit I use this tool RIGHT AWAY !!! I suction for 25 seconds a few times not just once. Follow the instructions and make sure you RELEASE THE SUCTION BEFORE TAKING AWAY FROM YOUR SKIN. I am so glad I ignored the negative reviews and purchased anyway because I am so happy with my purchase and will be purchasing more. I don't have 1 negative thing to say about this bug bite tool. Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Like a mini venom extractor!
customer_reviews.text: So fun. Like a tiny venom extractor. It may take a bit of force to get the venom out, but it actually works! Please use this for only the minor bites/stings like mosquitos, honey bees, common ants, and non-dangerous spider species. For things like desert centipedes, dangerous spiders, and insects with a sting pain classification of 2+, please use an actual venom extractor and seek medical attention if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are all true, it works but sometimes leaves a bruise. It just depends on the body part. I’ll get mosquito bites from being outside for 3 minutes, walking to my car, or even sitting on my couch. The bites itch, then swell, turn red and puffy, then eventually go down and turn in to a bruise. The first time I used this was on the side of my knee. The bite almost immediately went down and the next day was basically gone. However, when I used it on the back of my arm I did get a circular bruise from the suction. It doesn’t even matter though, it works
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Storck

customer_reviews.title: This Product Seriously Works!
customer_reviews.text: This product really works! I have lived by the beach for 3 years and each summer I get at least 20 to 40 mosquito/flea bites! To my own dismay, I will scratch my bites raw! With The Bug Bite Thing, I suction my bites a few times, alternating between bites, and there is seriously minimal to no scratching! I use to scratch for up to a week, but I only scratch when I first find out I have a bite, use TBBT, and then the itchy sensation is GONE!
customer_reviews.author: celine quiming

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: What a amazing tiny bug bite! Has to order again due to cracked. It is is working! I got bee stungs real bad. I had to do bug bite few times to make sure the liquid come out. Yes it is swollen but no itchy! Do it few time everday untill there is no liquid or itchy. I use tea tree balm to relief itching. My kids love to use it even my 4 years old boy can do this. Count to 20 seconds. Amazing wish have this when I waa younger haha P.s. order more so you can put one in the purse, bag or counter at kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: HMoM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first yone today on my 2 year old and I'm shocked at how well this worked. I cant believe it! Its amazing! Took the itch away immediately and now I dont even see a bite mark at all on her. All we did was walk outside to go to the car and she got bit 5 times. All 5 bites are nothing now. Thank you so much! My daughter is a bug magnet no matter how much bug spray I put on her and this was 100% the most awesome thing I've ever gotten! No more bad bug bites for her! I will be recommending this to everyone I know!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal L

customer_reviews.title: Allergic to mosquitos and this works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm allergic to mosquito bites and require prescription steroid application for several days. Each bite swells to at least an inch in size, gets hot and red, and itches for at least a week. Sleeping is uncomfortable and I need to use ice and ibuprofen regularly to treat. This item is a revelation for me. Quick application (when you get the white bump) works wonders. It doesn't remove the itchiness completely for me, but I don't get any of the swelling and don't have to use steroid creams any more (as long as I remove the mosquito saliva quickly after the bite).
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: Dont know if I’m using it right but here are pics after two days. I want to like it but idk... Last photo: redness went down a bit. It does help with itchiness after I use the suction. 9/11/20 Update: I was a bit skeptical about this device. My last photo shows it went away. So it does work, after using it for two days the area spreads but it goes away a day or two later!!!! The suction does make the itchiness go away! Crazy how it works tho. I get bitten up so much and get very itchy and this has helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I didn't believe the reviews, I was wrong
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastically. I thought it was a joke, but my wife and son get really bad marks from mosquito and when they started using this on new bites, it does an excellent job. We are buying more to give as gifts for other family members who also have issues with bug bites. I strongly recommend getting this if you get red marks from bug bites.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Metter

customer_reviews.title: Best $10+ you will ever spend on a bite helper!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago when the mosquitos and other bugs are the worse. Especially at night. The second picture between my fingers is where I got a big bite and its gone. And I can say it is the best $10 I have spent in my life. I spend a lot of time outside (I smoke boohoo but it's better than doing it inside) and every one of the bites I have used it on was gone within minutes. No itching no pain. I'm dead serious. This thing is now my new best friend during bug season! Get one! You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: It works by removing the venom
customer_reviews.text: It completely removed the mosquito bite by suctioning out the irritant. The suction does hurt and you need to be careful because it leaves a suction shaped ring whcich goes away in a few hours. I swell up from mosquito bites and this has worked better than topical creams and antihistamines. It is overpriced for what is essentially a plastic tube but it will save you from the discomfort of a bite. I used it s few times on a single bite. It works best if you use it immediately after you get bitten.
customer_reviews.author: Sing Chan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: This did nothing. Save your 10 bucks and go the drugstore for something more useful. And if you're in a pinch, some clear nail polish covering the entire bite will work, totally stops itching. Sounds weird I know, but it works and lasts. Obviously I'm not a doctor, just passing along something my friend learned while living out in the sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Works so fast!!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I’m amazed by this product. I saw it on TikTok and I usually get bit by mosquitos a lot during the summer so I thought I would try it. After a few suctions it was like the mosquito bite was never there. Then I happened to get stung by a wasp which is what is shown in the picture. The picture on the right was probably an hour after using the tool. It’s like it wasn’t even there. I’ve never been so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Reduces Bug Bite swelling and itch - Great for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: I have used other bug bit products but I like this one the best. There are no chemicals, no medicines, just the power of suction. My daughter's bug bites swell and this takes the swelling down considerably and helps with the itch. If the itch returns, it's an easy fix with another round of suction. This is a perfect tool for camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H.

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: My kids sell up like a balloon when they get bit, so calamine or aloe will help the itch but I'd rather avoid the swelling too. I got this going in 90% skeptical but figured it couldn't hurt. First campfire of the summer and of course they got bit. I used it before they swelled up, wherever u could see a bite or irritation forming. It worked great!! I even used it on a couple of bites of mine that were a day or 2 old and it stopped itching right away, and the bump was gone. I'll be getting another to put in the camping gear to make sure we have this all of the time
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Leaves you itchy and scarred
customer_reviews.text: The suction breaks blood vessels, leaving small red dots. It did not stop any itching. And months after using this, I still have scars and discoloration on my legs. I usually wear shorts, and I hate how my legs look like they’re bruised all the time now. The pictures I added are just a couple scarred spots.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: We followed the instructions exactly and used it on mosquito bites. The itching stopped relatively soon and the welt disappeared much sooner than usual. Mosquitos love both my husband and I; the ‘thing’ has made being outdoors much more comfortable. I still use organic repellants but as they are less effective in my opinion than DEET, this device will now be part of my travel kit. I haven’t tried it yet on the bites from no-see-ums as I typically end up itchy over a region but without a visible welt to apply the ‘thing’ to.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara the Traveller

customer_reviews.title: where has this been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: Mosquitoes love me, any biting bugs love me! this thing is a little miracle worker! seriously - i thought i'd give it a whirl even with mixed reviews. I used it a couple of hours after a few buggers got me. pain and itch were gone almost immediately! and the bit itself was gone the next day! i may buy more just to have them in all locations - by the pool, in the car, in my purse, etc.! don't think about it - just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I have to thank a tictok reviewer because I was desperate for itch relief so I bought this and it really does work!! Simple and it alleviates the itching so much that I have purchased more than one and recommend to a friend. So easy to use and my kids love it! Beware though cause it’s an easy item to use that my 8 yr old like the suction feeling and gave himself hickies on his face 😂. It will go away and it does not do that on a mosquito bite but I wanted to share how some kids might play with it
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: It actually works?!
customer_reviews.text: So my cousin told me about this, and i was skeptical until I was in the market for something without chemicals that I could use to get rid of the itch of mosquito bites. THIS thing actually works. If you use it within 2 days of getting the bite, I notice that it works better. It actually sucks the slightly thick clear gooey stuff from the bite, and then - it DOESN'T ITCH!!! That's really all I care about, because the itch is what bothers me the most. Keep in mind you may have a suction mark on the area for a couple hours!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: i was skeptical. but now...
customer_reviews.text: i am a believer. LOL. It works, it may take more than 1 suction per bite. i used it immediately after i got bit by those new no-see-them ankle biter mosquitos. It took about 80-90% of itch right away after 1 pump. As i work on the other bites, i would then circle back and do it multiple times. It stopped the itch, never swelled up and no meds. i like it. Wish it was cheaper so i can put it in different places like in garage, car, backyard. I'm a guy, i don't have a purse to store my essentials and i'm not gonna carry that in my pocket for no reason. :P
customer_reviews.author: sidewindr

customer_reviews.title: It helps gives relief for a minute
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting one of these for some time and finally got one in this hellish year of the mini mosquito bastars- thanks 2020! While I still am not regretful I bought it- its not mind blowing.... HOWEVER if you are itching like crazy it WILL relieve the itch for at least a minute. When the bites are bad i just use this thing over and over and hey, its better than nothing. Another suggestion: if you have one of those pore sucking vaccuums that works too!
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: It works !
customer_reviews.text: It totally works but you have to do it like 6-10 times for the itch to stop. I’m extremely allergic to mosquito bites and break out in huge welts , no one around me gets a bite and I come in completely covered head to toe no matter how much sprays I use. When I saw this on shark tank I literally ordered it right away lol. Like finally!!!! Overall I’m impressed and grateful this product exists. But not sure how longevity is since I haven’t used it in months- will update to see if it still has any life .
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Best money spent. My children and I are a buffet for mosquitoes during summer and this little Device works amazing giving the fact that it doesn’t use chemicals. I ca use it on anyone, any time, and it’s so easy to clean and reusable. I would definitely recommend this bug bite thing to everyone! The best thing of all is that it immediately stops the itching of the bite and the bite goes away within a few minutes of using it. It’s so easy even the kids can do it. You won’t regret this perchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lilian Perez

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I’m a mosquito magnet, & the itch drives me mad. I used this yesterday for the first time - had been scratching all day before I remembered it. As soon as I used it, the itch was gone. That being said, it is important that you use it gently & release pressure before you disengage it. I pumped it gently a few times as opposed to pulling the plunger up, then push it all the way to the down position to release the pressure so it doesn’t leave a mark when you remove. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sandie

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for this savior!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a skeptic, I’ve heard about this thing and I thought living in Texas I’ll try anything to help with mosquito bites. Wow, just wow! This thing totally works! It recommends only suctioning for 20 to 30 seconds but I’ll leave it on a little longer or stop after 30 seconds and suction again for another 30 seconds on the same bite spot. It definitely works, I couldn’t believe it. I recommended this little item to all my friends and family and I will probably give them away for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Flanny

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, but use it as soon as you realize you have a bite!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this contraption! And I'm not exactly disappointed... But the efficiency definitely depends on how quickly you use it. The instructions that come with it say that it works best if you use it within the first two minutes after a mosquito bite. And that's true! I've noticed that the quicker you do it, the more it helps. The longer you wait, the less itch it relieves. But overall, it was worth $10! It provides better itch relief than cortisone or calamine, plus it'll work on bee stings too.
customer_reviews.author: Minda Ann Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: My children generally swell so much their eyes swell shut if they get a mosquito bite on their forehead area - recently had a bite on my 4 yo that absolutely would’ve swollen her face up and shut her eye - so we used the Bug Bite Thing multiple times over a few days even as it started to swell and it was able to stave off the worst of it - mild swelling and quicker recovery! Non-chemical and not irritating like an onion would be - definitely keeping this on hand!!
customer_reviews.author: ND Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% perfect, but still pretty amazing
customer_reviews.text: You have to go into this item with the expectation that it won’t help every single bite you get. For the most part, it has helped me reduce swelling and itching on painful bites from first getting them to bites that have been there for a day or so. Certain bites this thing cannot satisfy, for example on the heel of your foot or another awkward area where suction cannot hold in place. Despite that, this along with some Hydro Cortizone cream has helped make my summer in Florida a lot less irritating. I highly recommend this product to anyone who struggles with bug bites.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: LISTEN THIS THING WORKS!!! OMG IT WORKS SOOOOO WELL. I'm like a mosquito magnet. I get bit so much that sometimes I have allergic reactions to it. This helped with the itching when I get bit. I carry it around with me and the second I feel the itch, I use it. It makes it go away. One time and that is it. That being said this is a suction tool and you should be careful where you use it. I used it on my friends head one time... it left a nice big bruise! LOL! You have to be sure you don't use it too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Manifa S.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked
customer_reviews.text: I heard so many mixed reviews about this product. And I really wanted it to work. The concept is great... it’s supposed to suction out the venom/saliva/stinger of whatever bit you. I bought this, and tried it on 8 different mosquito bites on my body. It DID NOT work and was not effective on me at all. When I first use it, immediately after I get bit, it seems to work. The bite stops growing, no redness. But the next morning, My bites still got swollen and had welts. My bites got to be about 4-5 inches in width even after trying this product. I was really hopeful but I’m so sad it wasn’t the one for me :(
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Birondo

customer_reviews.title: Best bug bite treatment ever!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe this thing actually worked! I’m a mosquito magnet and I’m also allergic to them, so my bites become the size of tennis balls, and sometimes bug repellent doesn’t work on me, so when I found this I wasn’t overly hopeful but I thought I’d try it. I got 9 bites the other night and tried it out...OMG. The itching went away almost immediately after, and when I woke up the next morning the bites were nearly GONE. It’s like a miracle! And it was so easy to use. So so so happy I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Ornella

customer_reviews.title: The Hype Is Real!!! Best Tool For Bug Bites
customer_reviews.text: I saw this one on the Shark Tank and ordered it right away. When I go on vacation the bugs love to bite me all over. This tool uses suction to take the venom right out of the skin taking away all of the irritation and redness. I was surprised at the suction power of this tool, it felt like it was working immediately. There are two sides to the tool, but I always used the larger side. In a week on vacation at the beach we used it about a dozen times. It worked every time and if I had more i easily could have sold them along the beach. Another shark tank gold item!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, not sure how effective it actually is
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely easy to use, sturdy, and has great suction. However I’m not sure yet if I am a believer in its efficacy. I’ve used it several times now on my kids and there doesn’t seem to be a huge difference in the development of their mosquito bites. However my husband got stung by a wasp on his ankle recently and I used this several times right after it happened. He never complained about the sting itching or swelling or hurting, so maybe there is something to it 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Candace Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Temporarily Relief
customer_reviews.text: This past summer, they were a lot of bugs where I live. If I don’t wear long sleeve shirt or long pants, I would’ve gotten bit by bugs while I’m out smoking in the yard. Bug Bite Thing would give a temporary itch relief. Most time though, I’ve had to use it multiple times in the same spot; sometimes 2-3 days. I like it, it’s easy to use, does its job (somewhat). Would I buy it again? Yes. Would I recommend it? Yes. I would’ve given it five-star review if I didn’t have to experience same spot itchiness multiple times a day and sometimes 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald K.

customer_reviews.title: Bruises the skin
customer_reviews.text: I am a magnet for mosquitoes and getting huge welts after getting bitten. I was hoping this would be better than the topical treatments currently available but can't say that it is. I was skeptical that it would even work at all, which I think it does to some extent. The biggest downside, however, is that it leaves large bruises after I use it that lasts for a few days. So if you don't mind sporting odd circles on your body, I'd recommend giving it a try at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So important for families playing outside
customer_reviews.text: This is the most valuable tool in our house! We love using it on all the mosquito bites we get while in our yard that get around the bug spray. It is super easy to use. My 3 year can do it by himself. I noticed that I need to leave it on myself for longer (at least a couple of minutes) to get a decrease in itchiness. We haven’t flipped it around successfully to the smaller surface area one and having it be 2 parts is sometimes hard for our family as both pieces would be lost in 2 locations
customer_reviews.author: katy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t do anything. Don’t waste your money. I too fell victim to the good reviews but I’m not really sure what any of these people are talking about. Does it appear to have good “suction” power, sure, does it actually suction *anything* out at all - nope. The bite was still there an hour later, a day later, a week later. If anything it aggravated it and made the spot itchier and worse for me.
customer_reviews.author: spartygirl87

customer_reviews.title: Even my child uses it
customer_reviews.text: Great little product for the price. Not sure if it really suctions out venom as it claims, but it does make my bug bites feel better if I use them right after being bit. Sometimes I have to do it twice on one spot to make the itch go away, but it definitely makes the swelling/size of the bite shrink right after usage! It can leave a "hickey" mark on some sensitive spots (under arm, & my 2 years old's back) so keep that in mind lol
customer_reviews.author: Erica S.

customer_reviews.title: It actually works! Quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it at least 7 or 8 times since I purchased it, on various gnat and mosquito bites. Only once did it not work, and it may have been too long after being bit for it to work that time. It really helps stop the itch and the bump goes down quickly too. It won't work in some hard to reach areas, or uneven areas, like a elbow. But it definitely stops the reaction and therefore I don't need to use any sprays, lotions, or take an antihistimine!
customer_reviews.author: B Perlik

customer_reviews.title: Haven't figured it out yet
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to try this product on a "fresh" bite that actually has a hole for something to be extracted. All of my bug bites I discover the next day and they are just bumps -- no hole for anything to actually be sucked from. The device provides some temporary relief from itching, but it doesn't actually remove anything. I will keep it around but don't really use it much for my current bug bites given that I don't discover them until a day or so later.
customer_reviews.author: Tim's Personal

customer_reviews.title: Didnt Work
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work well for me. I have had bug bites up and down my legs since March and the mosquitoes just seem to love me this year! I tried it quite a few times and it just didn’t really work for me at all. Maybe I wasn’t using it quick enough? I thought it was also pretty expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Easy relief!
customer_reviews.text: Having read the reviews for this before ordering, I was curious if this was actually going to help. Those little tiny aggressive mosquitos have become more common in California than wildfires... and just about every time I step outside in the evening my ankles get ravaged. Conveniently, the day JUST before this arrived I was bit a few times. I was pleasantly surprised that this gave me immediate relief from the annoying itchyness . So glad I took the leap of faith and ordered this bad boy as it now has a permanent place next to the big bite spray in my medicine cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bell

customer_reviews.title: Pops Blood Vessels
customer_reviews.text: Used this product and it popped the blood vessels around the skin - the mark went away after a couple days but that is an unfortunate consequence of this product if it sucks too hard on your skin. I will say that the bug bite did stop itching so it works in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Emil Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: The reviews speak for themselves, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had used my sister-in-law‘s while she was visiting and I was amazed. You will not regret this purchase. I find that it just depends on the type of bite/injury as to how effective it is but it is always effective, at least, at keeping the itch/sting away. I have used it for bug bites, cactus poison, slivers, and more and it’s worked great so far. Whether you’re outdoors in the summer or are you camp and hike a lot, this is an absolute need.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Hall

product_meta.title: Bug Bite Thing Suction Tool, Poison Remover - Bug Bites and Bee/Wasp Stings, Natural Insect Bite Relief, Chemical Free
feature_bullets: Removes insect venom, saliva, and other irritants left under the skin using suction
By removing the irritant, the body stops producing the reaction that is causing you to itch & swell
Works on: mosquitoes, bees, wasps, biting flies, no-see-ums, chiggers, sea lice & more
Compact, lightweight, reusable and easy to carry

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
